content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <feed xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"> <title>OceanDocs</title> <link href="http://oceandocs.org:80" rel="alternate"/> <subtitle>El repositorio digital OceanDocs captura, almacena, indexa, preserva y distribuye materiales de investigaci\ufffd\ufffdn en formato digital.</subtitle> <id xmlns="http://apache.org/cocoon/i18n/2.1">http://oceandocs.org:80</id> <updated>2015-03-19T17:40:39Z</updated> <dc:date>2015-03-19T17:40:39Z</dc:date> <entry> <title>\ufffd\ufffdtude Taxonomique et \ufffd\ufffdcophysiologique des dinoflagell\ufffd\ufffds toxiques du Golfe de Gab\ufffd\ufffds: Alexandrium minutum, Prorocentrum lima, Coolia spp. & Ostreopsis ovata.</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/1834/5924" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Abdennadher, M.</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/1834/5924</id> <updated>2015-02-27T15:53:23Z</updated> <published>2014-01-01T00:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">\ufffd\ufffdtude Taxonomique et \ufffd\ufffdcophysiologique des dinoflagell\ufffd\ufffds toxiques du Golfe de Gab\ufffd\ufffds: Alexandrium minutum, Prorocentrum lima, Coolia spp. & Ostreopsis ovata. Abdennadher, M. Cette th\ufffd\ufffdse a pour objectif principal la caract\ufffd\ufffdrisation taxonomique, physiologique et \ufffd\ufffdcologique d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdesp\ufffd\ufffdces de dinoflagell\ufffd\ufffds associ\ufffd\ufffdes \ufffd\ufffd des alertes de toxicit\ufffd\ufffd dans le golfe de Gab\ufffd\ufffds \ufffd\ufffd savoir : Alexandrium minutum, Prorocentrum lima, Coolia monotis et Ostreopsis ovata. L\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdoptimisation des conditions de culture des esp\ufffd\ufffdces de dinoflagell\ufffd\ufffds et la mise en place d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdune phytoth\ufffd\ufffdque compos\ufffd\ufffde d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdune collection de cultures de microalgues toxiques \ufffd\ufffdtaient notre priorit\ufffd\ufffd dans cette investigation. Une analyse de la base des donn\ufffd\ufffdes REPHY a \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd effectu\ufffd\ufffde dans le cadre de cette th\ufffd\ufffdse. L\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdtude taxonomique moyennant la microscopie \ufffd\ufffdlectronique en transmission et \ufffd\ufffd balayage nous a permis de d\ufffd\ufffdceler les importantes caract\ufffd\ufffdristiques morphologiques de distinction pour chaque esp\ufffd\ufffdce \ufffd\ufffdtudi\ufffd\ufffde \ufffd\ufffd savoir la pr\ufffd\ufffdsence de pore apicale chez A. minutum et l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdexistence d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdune petite taille et d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdune plaque hexagonale occupant le centre gauche de l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdpith\ufffd\ufffdque chez O. ovata. Pour P. lima, la pr\ufffd\ufffdsence d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdun pyr\ufffd\ufffdnoide centrale, la forme en V de la zone p\ufffd\ufffdrifalgellaire avec 8 plaquettes et l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdexistence des bandes intercalaires ont \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd d\ufffd\ufffdmontr\ufffd\ufffdes. Les plaques pentagonales 3\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd et 7\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd et la plaque 1\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdoblongue et \ufffd\ufffdtroite ont \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd identifi\ufffd\ufffdes chez C. monotis. La caract\ufffd\ufffdrisation de deux marqueurs mol\ufffd\ufffdculaires, les r\ufffd\ufffdgions ITS incluant le g\ufffd\ufffdne 5.8S et les domaines D1, D2 et D3 de l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdADNr 28S, confirme l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdidentification morphologique et r\ufffd\ufffdv\ufffd\ufffdle que les esp\ufffd\ufffdces \ufffd\ufffdtudi\ufffd\ufffdes pr\ufffd\ufffdsentent soit une identit\ufffd\ufffd totale soit une forte homologie avec des souches d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdorigine m\ufffd\ufffdditerran\ufffd\ufffdenne et atlantique. L\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdanalyse pigmentaire avec HPLC montre principalement que les souches \ufffd\ufffdtudi\ufffd\ufffdes poss\ufffd\ufffddent des chloroplastes de type I. Le test de souris appliqu\ufffd\ufffd pour certaines souches des esp\ufffd\ufffdces \ufffd\ufffdtudi\ufffd\ufffdes montre qu\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdelles sont toxiques et que la toxicit\ufffd\ufffd pr\ufffd\ufffdsente une variabilit\ufffd\ufffd intra sp\ufffd\ufffdcifique. Chez les esp\ufffd\ufffdces \ufffd\ufffdtudi\ufffd\ufffdes, il a \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd d\ufffd\ufffdmontr\ufffd\ufffd que la croissance est tr\ufffd\ufffds variable \ufffd\ufffd l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdchelle inter et intra sp\ufffd\ufffdcifique. L\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdtude \ufffd\ufffdcologique a montr\ufffd\ufffd que la prolif\ufffd\ufffdration de ces inoflagell\ufffd\ufffds toxiques dans le golfe de Gab\ufffd\ufffds suit un rythme saisonnier, le plus souvent elle est printani\ufffd\ufffdre \ufffd\ufffd estivale avec toutefois des pics furtifs en automne. L\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdanalyse de la base de donn\ufffd\ufffdes a permis de r\ufffd\ufffdv\ufffd\ufffdler que la distribution du nombre d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdalertes phytoplanctoniques et biotoxine pr\ufffd\ufffdsentent une variation annuelle et saisonni\ufffd\ufffdre selon les zones de collecte de palourdes. Ces deux types d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdalerte sont totalement ind\ufffd\ufffdpendants l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdun de l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdautre. Diff\ufffd\ufffdrents seuils de toxicit\ufffd\ufffd et de temps de s\ufffd\ufffdjours ont \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd identifi\ufffd\ufffds chez les esp\ufffd\ufffdces toxiques signal\ufffd\ufffdes dans le golfe de Gabes.; In this study, the taxonomic, ecological and physiological characterizations of dinoflagellate species associated with toxicity alerts in the Gulf of Gabes were carried out namely for Alexandrium minutum, Prorocentrum lima, Coolia monotis and Ostreopsis ovata. The optimization of culture conditions for dinoflagellate species and the establishment of a phytotheque composed of a toxic microalgae cultures collection were our priority in this investigation. An analysis of the REPHY databases was also conducted. The morphological study using scanning and transmission electron microscopy allowed us to identify significant morphological characters of distinction for each of the studied species, namely the presence of apical pore in A. minutum and the existence of a small and an hexagonal plate occupying the left epitheca central in O. ovata. For P. lima, the presence of a central pyrenoid, the V-shape of the p\ufffd\ufffdrifalgellaire area with 8 platelets and the existence of dividing strips have been demonstrated. The pentagonal plates 3' and 7'' and the narrow plate 1'oblongue have been identified in C. monotis. The characterization of two molecular markers: the D1-D2-D3 hypervariable domains of the 28S gene and the non coding internal transcribed spacers, ITS-1 and ITS-2 including the 5.8S gene confirms the morphological identification and reveals that the studied species have either a total identity or high homology with strains of Mediterranean and Atlantic origin. The pigment analysis with HPLC shows mainly that the studied strains have chloroplasts of type I. The mouse test applied to some strains shows that species are toxic and that toxicity presents an intra-specific variability. An-inter and intra-specific variability of growth was detected among studied strains. The ecological study showed that the proliferation of toxic dinoflagellates in the Gulf of Gabes follows a seasonal pattern, and it occurs mostly in spring and summer with autumn peaks. Analysis of the database revealed that the distribution of the phytoplankton and biotoxin alerts has a seasonal and annual variation according to the collection areas of clams. These two types of alerts are totally independent of each other. Different toxic levels and time of detoxification were identified among reported toxic species in the Gulf of Gabes. </summary> <dc:date>2014-01-01T00:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Etude de la structure g\ufffd\ufffdn\ufffd\ufffdtique des populations de la tortue marine Caretta caretta dans les eaux tunisiennes.</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/1834/5923" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Chaieb, O.</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/1834/5923</id> <updated>2015-02-27T15:57:14Z</updated> <published>2013-01-01T00:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Etude de la structure g\ufffd\ufffdn\ufffd\ufffdtique des populations de la tortue marine Caretta caretta dans les eaux tunisiennes. Chaieb, O. La tortue marine, la caouanne (Caretta caretta), est une esp\ufffd\ufffdce en danger d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdextinction. Elle est caract\ufffd\ufffdris\ufffd\ufffde par un cycle biologique complexe se basant sur une s\ufffd\ufffdrie de transitions \ufffd\ufffdcologiques et g\ufffd\ufffdographiques n\ufffd\ufffdcessitant des migrations sur de longues distances. En Tunisie, plusieurs \ufffd\ufffdtudes ont \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd r\ufffd\ufffdalis\ufffd\ufffdes sur les activit\ufffd\ufffds de nidification et les interactions avec les activit\ufffd\ufffds de p\ufffd\ufffdche, mais, aucune n\ufffd\ufffd\ufffda port\ufffd\ufffd sur l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdtude g\ufffd\ufffdn\ufffd\ufffdtique de cette esp\ufffd\ufffdce. Dans ce travail, nous nous sommes int\ufffd\ufffdress\ufffd\ufffds \ufffd\ufffd l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdanalyse g\ufffd\ufffdn\ufffd\ufffdtique de la population nidifiante en Tunisie et des populations des tortues se d\ufffd\ufffdveloppant dans les zones n\ufffd\ufffdritiques tunisiennes.  La population nidifiante a \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd appr\ufffd\ufffdhend\ufffd\ufffde par l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdanalyse des nouveau-n\ufffd\ufffds \ufffd\ufffdchantillonn\ufffd\ufffds durant une p\ufffd\ufffdriode de sept ans sur le principal site de ponte des \ufffd\ufffdles Kuriat (Monastir). Deux approches ont \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd utilis\ufffd\ufffdes : une approche allozymique et une autre mol\ufffd\ufffdculaire. Douze syst\ufffd\ufffdmes enzymatiques cod\ufffd\ufffds par 17 loci ont \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd analys\ufffd\ufffds parmi lesquels sept se sont r\ufffd\ufffdv\ufffd\ufffdl\ufffd\ufffds polymorphes. D\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdautre part, l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdanalyse d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdun fragment de 380 pb de la r\ufffd\ufffdgion de contr\ufffd\ufffdle de l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdADN mitochondrial n\ufffd\ufffd\ufffda r\ufffd\ufffdv\ufffd\ufffdl\ufffd\ufffd qu\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdun seul haplotype CC-A2. Le tr\ufffd\ufffds faible niveau de variabilit\ufffd\ufffd g\ufffd\ufffdn\ufffd\ufffdtique enregistr\ufffd\ufffd chez cette population par les deux approches, ajout\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd sa faible taille, pourraient \ufffd\ufffdtre les cons\ufffd\ufffdquences d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdun r\ufffd\ufffdcent ph\ufffd\ufffdnom\ufffd\ufffdne de d\ufffd\ufffdrive g\ufffd\ufffdn\ufffd\ufffdtique cons\ufffd\ufffdcutive fort probablement, \ufffd\ufffd un goulot d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdtranglement. En effet, la pression anthropique exerc\ufffd\ufffde depuis quelques dizaines d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdann\ufffd\ufffdes aurait caus\ufffd\ufffd une \ufffd\ufffdrosion g\ufffd\ufffdn\ufffd\ufffdtique de la population nidifiante des caouannes sur les \ufffd\ufffdles Kuriat. L\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdtude allozymique a permis, \ufffd\ufffdgalement, de montrer que 50% des nouveau-n\ufffd\ufffds proviennent de la f\ufffd\ufffdcondation par aux moins deux m\ufffd\ufffdles. Ce comportement de la paternit\ufffd\ufffd multiple jouerait un r\ufffd\ufffdle important dans la diversit\ufffd\ufffd g\ufffd\ufffdn\ufffd\ufffdtique de la population nidifiante et dans la p\ufffd\ufffdrennit\ufffd\ufffd de l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdesp\ufffd\ufffdce.  Par ailleurs, une analyse mol\ufffd\ufffdculaire du m\ufffd\ufffdme fragment de l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdADNmt a \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd r\ufffd\ufffdalis\ufffd\ufffde sur 175 tortues juv\ufffd\ufffdniles et adultes, \ufffd\ufffdchou\ufffd\ufffdes et captur\ufffd\ufffdes accidentellement, durant une p\ufffd\ufffdriode de 6 ans (2004 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 2009). Ces tortues ont \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdchantillonn\ufffd\ufffdes sur tout le littoral tunisien. Sept haplotypes mitochondriaux ont \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd trouv\ufffd\ufffds et la diversit\ufffd\ufffd g\ufffd\ufffdn\ufffd\ufffdtique la plus \ufffd\ufffdlev\ufffd\ufffde a \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd enregistr\ufffd\ufffde chez la population des tortues se d\ufffd\ufffdveloppant dans les c\ufffd\ufffdtes nord tunisiennes (CNT). Une diff\ufffd\ufffdrence g\ufffd\ufffdn\ufffd\ufffdtique a \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd enregistr\ufffd\ufffde entre cette population et celle du golfe de Gab\ufffd\ufffds (GGAB), alors qu\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdaucune diff\ufffd\ufffdrence n\ufffd\ufffd\ufffda \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd trouv\ufffd\ufffde entre ces deux populations et celle du golfe de Hammamet (GHAM). L\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdanalyse des stocks mixtes (ASM) a montr\ufffd\ufffd une contribution \ufffd\ufffdlev\ufffd\ufffde des tortues d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdorigine atlantique dans le CNT qui diminue progressivement en allant vers le sud, alors que les proportions des tortues d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdorigine m\ufffd\ufffdditerran\ufffd\ufffdenne \ufffd\ufffdtaient plus \ufffd\ufffdlev\ufffd\ufffdes dans le GGAB et diminuaient dans le sens oppos\ufffd\ufffd. L\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdhydrodynamique et la g\ufffd\ufffdomorphologie des milieux seraient les principaux facteurs d\ufffd\ufffdterminant la distribution des tortues des deux origines diff\ufffd\ufffdrentes, atlantique et m\ufffd\ufffdditerran\ufffd\ufffdenne et le pattern de la variabilit\ufffd\ufffd  g\ufffd\ufffdn\ufffd\ufffdtique cons\ufffd\ufffdquente.  En conclusion, cette \ufffd\ufffdtude a permis d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdune part, de constater un faible niveau de diversit\ufffd\ufffd g\ufffd\ufffdn\ufffd\ufffdtique ce qui t\ufffd\ufffdmoigne de la vuln\ufffd\ufffdrabilit\ufffd\ufffd de la population nidifiante des caouannes sur les \ufffd\ufffdles Kuriat. D\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdautre part, nous avons montr\ufffd\ufffd que les zones de d\ufffd\ufffdveloppement n\ufffd\ufffdritiques tunisiennes sont fr\ufffd\ufffdquent\ufffd\ufffdes par des tortues aussi bien d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdorigine m\ufffd\ufffdditerran\ufffd\ufffdenne qu\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdatlantique. Les fr\ufffd\ufffdquences relatives de ces tortues varient d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdune r\ufffd\ufffdgion \ufffd\ufffd une autre et semblent \ufffd\ufffdtre d\ufffd\ufffdtermin\ufffd\ufffdes principalement par des facteurs abiotiques. Les r\ufffd\ufffdsultats de la pr\ufffd\ufffdsente \ufffd\ufffdtude sont d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdun apport consid\ufffd\ufffdrable pour la compr\ufffd\ufffdhension des particularit\ufffd\ufffds biologiques et \ufffd\ufffdcologiques de cette esp\ufffd\ufffdce et devraient \ufffd\ufffdtre pris en consid\ufffd\ufffdration dans les futures strat\ufffd\ufffdgies de conservation.; The loggerhead sea turtle Caretta caretta is an endangered species. It has a complex life cycle which is characterized by a series of ecological transitions associated with continuous movements and habitats shifts. In Tunisia, previous studies focused on the monitoring of the stranding events and the interaction with fisheries. However, no effort has been done to genetically characterize the nesting and foraging populations.  Genetic diversity of loggerhead nesting population on the Kuriat Islands, the most important Tunisian nesting beach, was investigated using both nuclear and mitochondrial markers. The analysis of seventeen loci coding for twelve enzymatic systems by allozyme electrophoresis revealed seven polymorphic loci. A low genetic diversity was detected. The genotypic composition of half of the clutches did not match Mendelian expectations suggesting the occurrence of multiple paternity estimated at 50%. The analysis of 380 bp of the mitochondrial DNA control region revealed no genetic variability. Only one haplotype was described which corresponds to the sequence of the most common haplotype found on the Mediterranean nesting beaches (CC-A2). The low genetic diversity detected by both mitochondrial and allozyme markers added to the very small nesting effort could be induced by a recent bottleneck event caused by anthropogenic activities. Foraging population in neritic Tunisian developmental zones was investigated using a molecular approach. We conducted extensive sampling of 175 juvenile and adult loggerhead turtles that were stranded or incidentally captured in the areas along the northern (NTC), eastern (Gulf of Hammamet, GHAM) and southern (Gulf of Gab\ufffd\ufffds, GGAB) Tunisian coast during a six-year period (2004-2009). A 380 bp fragment of the mitochondrial DNA control region was sequenced and analysed. Seven haplotypes were revealed and a gradual variation in haplotype frequencies was observed among the studied areas. The extreme samples (NTC and GGAB) differed genetically from each other while both were similar to the central sample (GHAM). This finding was confirmed by the MSA estimates which suggested that the proportions of Atlantic turtles were very high in the NTC and decreased southward, while the proportions of Mediterranean contributions were higher in the GGAB and decreased in the opposite direction. The observed pattern of genetic variation and turtle distribution is probably related to differences in geomorphology and sea surface currents among these coastal areas.  In conclusion, adequate conservation measures should be considered in future management plans to protect both the vulnerable nesting and foraging populations in the study area. </summary> <dc:date>2013-01-01T00:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Effet du Benzo(a)pyr\ufffd\ufffdne sur la communaut\ufffd\ufffd phytoplanctonique du canal et de la lagune de Bizerte</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/1834/5922" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Ben Othman, H.</name> </author> <author> <name>Meddeb, M.</name> </author> <author> <name>Hadj Mabrouk, H.</name> </author> <author> <name>Hlaili, S.</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/1834/5922</id> <updated>2015-02-17T14:42:38Z</updated> <published>2013-01-01T00:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Effet du Benzo(a)pyr\ufffd\ufffdne sur la communaut\ufffd\ufffd phytoplanctonique du canal et de la lagune de Bizerte Ben Othman, H.; Meddeb, M.; Hadj Mabrouk, H.; Hlaili, S. La lagune de Bizerte devient un r\ufffd\ufffdcepteur privil\ufffd\ufffdgi\ufffd\ufffd des micropolluants dont certains sont toxiques et peuvent constituer une menace pour l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdquilibre de cet \ufffd\ufffdcosyst\ufffd\ufffdme. Parmi ces polluants, les hydrocarbures aromatiques polycycliques (HAP) sont retenus comme des polluants prioritaires. La pr\ufffd\ufffdsente \ufffd\ufffdtude est une premi\ufffd\ufffdre investigation de l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdeffet d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdun HAP, le Benzo(a)pyr\ufffd\ufffdne [B(a)py], sur la communaut\ufffd\ufffd phytoplanctonique au niveau d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdune station lagunaire (station plus ou mois pollu\ufffd\ufffde par le B(a)py) et une station au niveau du canal (station la plus pollu\ufffd\ufffde par le B(a)py) en \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd (juillet) et automne (novembre) 2009. Pour cela, des communaut\ufffd\ufffds phytoplanctoniques, collect\ufffd\ufffdes des deux stations, ont \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd maintenues en culture pendant 6 jours sous trois diff\ufffd\ufffdrents traitements, un t\ufffd\ufffdmoin (non contamin\ufffd\ufffd) et deux contaminations avec 0,5 mg l-1 (traitement B1) et 1 mg l-1 (traitement B2) du B(a)py. Au cours des incubations, la chlorophylle a (Chl a), le taux de croissance phytoplanctonique ont \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd d\ufffd\ufffdtermin\ufffd\ufffds. Les r\ufffd\ufffdsultats ont r\ufffd\ufffdv\ufffd\ufffdl\ufffd\ufffd qu\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdau niveau de la station canal, les deux contaminations par le B(a)py n\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdont induit aucun effet ni sur la Chl a ni sur la croissance microalgale en novembre. La forte contamination a \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd m\ufffd\ufffdme suivie par une stimulation de la prolif\ufffd\ufffdration du phytoplancton en juillet. Ceci sugg\ufffd\ufffdre que le phytoplancton des eaux du canal serait plus r\ufffd\ufffdsistant aux fortes concentrations en B(a)py, car cette station, situ\ufffd\ufffde en face de la cimenterie de Bizerte, est parmi les zones les plus pollu\ufffd\ufffdes par ce contaminant. Par contre, au niveau de la station lagune, au cours des deux mois, les taux de croissance duphytoplancton, apr\ufffd\ufffds les deux contaminations, ont baiss\ufffd\ufffd. Ceci indique que les microalgues pr\ufffd\ufffdsentes dans cette station, milieu moins pollu\ufffd\ufffd que la station canal, seraient sensibles au B(a)py.; The Bizerte lagoon is becoming a key receptor for several micro-pollutants, which are sometimes toxic and may pose a threat to the ecosystem. Among these pollutants, polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAH) were selected as priority pollutants. The present study investigated for the first time the effect of Benzo(a)pyrene [B(a)py] on phytoplankton community in a lagoonal station (station moderately polluted by the B(a)py) and a station at the channel (station highly polluted by B(a)py) of Bizerte in summer (July) and autumn (November) 2009. For this, phytoplankton communities collected from these stations were maintained in culture for 6 days under three different treatments: a control (uncontaminated) and two contaminations with 0.5 mg l-1 (treatment B1) and 1 mg l- 1 (treatment B2) of B(a)py. During the incubations, chlorophyll a (Chl a), the growth rate of phytoplankton were measured for the three treatments. The results showed that at the channel, both contaminations with B(a)py did not induce any effect neither on Chl a nor on microalgal growth in November. High B(a)py contamination was even followed by a stimulation of phytoplankton growth in July. This suggests that the phytoplankton originated from the channel was more resistant to high concentrations of B(a)py, because this area, located approximately of ciment industry is among the most polluted areas by B(a)py. However, at the lagoonal station, the growth rates of phytoplankton declined after both PAH contaminations. This indicates that the microalgae present in this station, environment less polluted than the channel, were sensitive to B(a)py. </summary> <dc:date>2013-01-01T00:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Evaluation de la qualite nutritionnelle de la sardinelle ronde sardinella aurita (valenciennes, 1847)) du Golfe de Tunis</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/1834/5921" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Ennouri, R.</name> </author> <author> <name>Mili, S.</name> </author> <author> <name>Chouba, L.</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/1834/5921</id> <updated>2015-02-17T14:42:38Z</updated> <published>2013-01-01T00:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Evaluation de la qualite nutritionnelle de la sardinelle ronde sardinella aurita (valenciennes, 1847)) du Golfe de Tunis Ennouri, R.; Mili, S.; Chouba, L. L\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdallache ou sardinelle ronde (Sardinella aurita, Valenciennes, 1847) est une esp\ufffd\ufffdce de la famille des Clupeidae \ufffd\ufffd affinit\ufffd\ufffd intertropicale. Cette esp\ufffd\ufffdce est la plus repr\ufffd\ufffdsent\ufffd\ufffde dans les produits de la p\ufffd\ufffdche en Tunisie. Dans cette \ufffd\ufffdtude on a \ufffd\ufffdvalu\ufffd\ufffd la qualit\ufffd\ufffd nutritionnelle de ce poisson en \ufffd\ufffdvaluant sa richesse en oligo-\ufffd\ufffdl\ufffd\ufffdments et en acides gras. Pour ce fait, on a suivi les concentrations saisonni\ufffd\ufffdres de ces \ufffd\ufffdl\ufffd\ufffdments dans quatre organes dont certains sont les plus consomm\ufffd\ufffds \ufffd\ufffd savoir la chair et les gonades. Par contre, d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdautres sont facultativement consomm\ufffd\ufffds par les habitants de certaines r\ufffd\ufffdgions de la Tunisie notamment le cerveau et le foie. Les \ufffd\ufffdchantillons de la sardinelle ont \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd collect\ufffd\ufffds mensuellement aupr\ufffd\ufffds des embarcations professionnelles utilisant une senne tournante (p\ufffd\ufffdche au feu) \ufffd\ufffd bord des barques de p\ufffd\ufffdche professionnelles au niveau de la r\ufffd\ufffdgion c\ufffd\ufffdti\ufffd\ufffdre de Ghar El Melh. Cette r\ufffd\ufffdgion a \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd choisie en raison de sa richesse en ressources halieutiques et de son accessibilit\ufffd\ufffd. L\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdanalyse des oligo-\ufffd\ufffdl\ufffd\ufffdments (Ca, Na, K, Mg, Fe et Mn) a \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd r\ufffd\ufffdalis\ufffd\ufffde \ufffd\ufffd l\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdaide d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdun Spectrophotom\ufffd\ufffdtre d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdAbsorption Atomique \ufffd\ufffd flamme. L\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdanalyse des acides gras a \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd effectu\ufffd\ufffde par Chromatographie en Phase Gazeuse. Les r\ufffd\ufffdsultats obtenus ont montr\ufffd\ufffd que les concentrations de tous les oligo-\ufffd\ufffdl\ufffd\ufffdments \ufffd\ufffdtudi\ufffd\ufffds dans les gonades de la sardinelle suivent une variation saisonni\ufffd\ufffdre avec un pic en \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd (p\ufffd\ufffdriode de pr\ufffd\ufffd-ponte dont les gonades sont les plus d\ufffd\ufffdvelopp\ufffd\ufffdes). De plus, on a not\ufffd\ufffd que le cerveau repr\ufffd\ufffdsente le site pr\ufffd\ufffdf\ufffd\ufffdrentiel d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdaccumulation du Ca et du Na et le foie pour le Fe, le Mn et Mg. Les r\ufffd\ufffdsultats des analyses biochimiques montrent une variabilit\ufffd\ufffd saisonni\ufffd\ufffdre remarquable au niveau de la composition lipidique et du profil en acides gras. Le taux maximal des lipides a \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd enregistr\ufffd\ufffd en \ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffd pour les sardinelles de la r\ufffd\ufffdgion nord. L\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdtude des diff\ufffd\ufffdrentes familles d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdacides gras montre que les AGPI repr\ufffd\ufffdsentent la fraction majoritaire pendant la saison printani\ufffd\ufffdre. L\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdaugmentation des AGPI est toujours accompagn\ufffd\ufffde d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdune diminution des AGS.; The aim of this study is to evaluate the levels of oligo-elements (Mg, Ca, Na, K, Fe and Mn) and fatty acids in four tissues (muscle, liver, brain and gonads) of a pelagic teleost species, the Round Sardinella(Sardinela aurita). This pelagic fish is one of the most important landed species in gulf of Tunis. The specie is considered as a common species in this area throughout the all seasons. In this study, organotropism, and seasonal effect of oligo-elements and fatty acids accumulation was determined. The concentrations of Mg, Ca, Na, K, Fe and Mn were performed using Flame Atomic Absorption Spectrophotometry. Fatty acids were analysed by Gas Chromatography. The results showed a seasonal variation in all elements in gonad with a peak in summer. Additionally, the brain is the preferential site for accumulation of Ca and Na and liver for Fe, Mg and Mn. The results concerning fatty acids demonstrate that the levels of monounsaturated and saturated acids increase when the levels of polyunsaturated fatty acids decrease in all tissues of Round Sardinella. Lipid levels of displayed pronounced seasonal fluctuations, with the highest value in summer. In addition, the highest level of index n-3/n-6 was observed in flesh during spring season. It is concluded that the Round Sardinella is a particularly healthy item in the human diet during spring period, when balanced n-3/n-6 ratios and EPA and DHA levels are considered. </summary> <dc:date>2013-01-01T00:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> </feed>
